Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, A Bit Dated, Free Internet”
Reviews.Author: Pnguyen10
Reviews.Content: Even though this place is well worn, the place is kept very clean (not dirty). The room is spacious. The fridge smelled a bit and didn't keep cold very long, but mostly not a problem. This is a no frills, good affordable hotel. Free internet is available to one device at a time/one log-in at a time. Internet is fast and reliable. Bed is comfortable and clean. The staff is not over the top friendly but are helpful and nice. Very close to metro station on a quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “good location 5 minutes from the metro for an budget stopover”
Reviews.Author: -Man0nTheMove-
Reviews.Content: We wanted a budget hotel for an short stopover near the metro an the airport and not to far from the city and it does the trick! LOCATION: The hotel was a literally 5 minutes walk from the "Union Square" metro station which was very convenient for travelling to and from the airport in approx. 15 minutes. it is located in the 19th al rigga road and very easy to find from the metro station (there a maps everywhere which tells you where you actually are). You can explore the city very easy because the "Union Square" metro station is also the intersection of the two metro lines. You need approx. 15 minutes to the airport and approx. 25 to burj kalifa/dubai mall. The creek is reachable by food in 10-15 minutes and you can take a water bus from there to the old- or gold souk. ROOM Check in was efficient, we got room 101 right next to the elevator but noise was not an issue. The room looks exactly like the pictures show it, only the TV is replaced by a gigantic flat screen. The bathroom (with bathtub) looks a bit used and could be cleaner, but water pressure was good, toiletries provided and towels where clean so nothing to complain for the price paid. The fridge was not plugged in and i took me some time to figure out which light switch actually switches the light off without switching another on but i finally got it! Free Wifi in the rooms if needed. Breakfast wasn`t included so can`t comment. FAZIT: We paid 40 euro/night and got a well located hotel for our purpose (short stopover) and you can’t expect more for the money paid in regarding hotels quite pricy Dubai!

Reviews.Title: “free internet”
Reviews.Author: Iwan89
Reviews.Content: Very spacious rooms, very close to the metro station. Dubai is a very safe city, but it happens here in this location is a little lower area of the city. A huge advantage of the hotel is free internet, I know from experience that what may be surprising, but in a Dubai hotel with free internet hard and Normally you need to have very much to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient 2 star hotel in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: peperi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tucked away down a side street near the Metro Station and Al Ghurair Shopping Centre and within easy distance to the Airport. The staff were cooperative and friendly and ensured that our needs were met with no fuss. The hotel is rated as a 2 star by the Dubai rating agency but would easily meet 3+ Star status in another country. There is a swimming pool and other facilities available in the hotel which would not be normally available in a 2 star hotel. The area is close to a mosque and among a lot of low rent apartments so there are a lot of workers moving along the streets during the day & night. The hotel is a good hotel to use for a transit stop or weekend in Dubai although car parking would be an issue if you were driving there.

Reviews.Title: “Gave away my Reservation, dodgy as it gets, no customer service”
Reviews.Author: Maverick572
Reviews.Content: I arrived later than anticipated due to some problems with my car hire. The Receptionist did not speak English, and just repeated "No Reservation!" Even though my fiancee double confirmed, confirmed the free internet and has a series of email correspondance with Essam Elkomy, the manager. So, despite a bad bout of food poisoning, I had to find a usable wifi connection in Deira so I could book in somewhere else! And all this in between the hours of 2:30 and 7:00 in the morning. Never stay here, no guarantees!

Reviews.Title: “Not recomended”
Reviews.Author: Tcar12
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel after reading some reviews and unfortunately the only one that i did not read was the only real one. For starting i can say that the adress is not correcty and i had trouble finding it because is not in the oposite side of the maktoum hospital. The staff at the lobby is very slow and not pleasant with costumers and about the hotel itself i can only say that i only stayed there for 3h and i left!! Rooms smell bad, the bathroom is a joke, air condicioner is very noisy and puts the air directly in your face and the worst of it is that there is a disco club rigth bellow so it´s impossible to sleep with the noise of the music and people on the street, with taxis pushing the horn untill 4am......i guess this was the baddest experience in my life and even some 8€ hotels that i stayed in thailand were a lot better them this place. Even for a low budget i do not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Chiisaineko
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel for someone travelling on a budget in Dubai. The service is good and it's a clean and quiet hotel. Not much going on in the neighborhood though, so not a place for party people (and alcohol strictly forbidden).

Reviews.Title: “Good price-quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: Juho-PekkaK
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet and comfortable room. Very helpful and friendly staff. Good location near Union metro station. This hotel was difficult to find because the address was incorrect.. It's just in opposite of Al Maktoum Hospital.

HotelInfo.Name: Al Jawhara Metro
HotelInfo.Address: Al Rigga Rd, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
